last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
So the current Inori event. The anon in last thread was right, there isn't much going on yuri wise. I did like in the prologue when the respective pairing partner cheered for the participants. God it felt good to hear Megumin cheer for Tama. And Miya going nuts for Yuina.

It's probably the most chill event yet plot and drama wise. I don't support the death penalty and have mixed feelings about the way it is promoted as mercy in this context, but it's more about the mindset of Inori's swordstyle I suppose. She doesn't judge, she wants to kindly end the suffering or whatever.

I really liked the dynamic between Inori and Osagawara specifically. I think this has potential to go a lot further. The way she forced the master/student relationship on Inori was hilarious and unlike Ruka she can actually read Inori's mind. Love that Ruka's only purpose in this event was to show off how bad she is at understandig Inorin.

Something I've noticed is that the U140 Event has a special place, because it keeps getting referenced in other Events. This is the third time it was referenced (it also happened in the Koju event where Vrittika and Yotsuha were shown to be pretty close thanks to the Maruyama unit experience). And this time they actually straight up have Inori talking about the plot of that mission to Maruyama (plus tensai kenshi using Vrittika's "Nirvanaaa~" line lol). Of all the events this one and the Yuina one seem to have the most future plot relevance. Tezuka seemed to figure out something aout a different group researching Cancer, outside the seraph unit and military in U140, so that may be why.

Speaking of Yuina, this is actually the first time I really felt taken out by how much she got put on a pedastal. It didn't happen before, because she was either not in the focus or shown how flawed she actually is, but in this event she is definitely the godlike senpai that everyone admires. It makes sense to a degree, but it felt too much for me.

>>3834859
>I commented mainly on the topic of lesbian fiction written by men and lesbian fiction written by women, and did not claim that every book of any genre ever written adheres to these golden rules.
No, you claimed that stories by one side "tend to do A" and another "tend to do B". Let's not try and backpedal this into pretending you said "oh yeah, sometimes guys write idealized romance". The point of what I said is that you claimed that idealized romance is a tendency of male-authored stories and something you can pick up on to gauge the sex of the author, when in reality, the hard statistical numbers show the exact opposite, that most idealized romance stories are being (and have been) written by women.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>3833921
Want a good one? Chapter 14 is one of earliest Mio/Shizuka stories and the first time something romantic, rather than horny, happens in their relationship. Valentine's day is in mid-February, the Japanese school year ends in March and Shizuka is a third year. Thus, the entirety of Mio and Shizuka's storyline has happened in six weeks in late winter/early spring (including a visit to a summer festival), while Shizuka's been taking her entrance exams.

i think the original idea was that the chapters are just anecdotes from one year in the girls' lives, told in a non-chronological order. That's why the time jumps around but no pair celebrates Valentine's day or Christmas twice. This made more sense when everyone's relationships were more or less static but is obviously a mess now that they've started advancing. Just take it in the same spirit as Yuru Yuri or Peanuts.

last_replies.com:
>>3830894
(cont.d)

If you limit your free award Exp to your starting team and run farming stages for the various upgrade systems each once as they unlock (Resource Collection - Potential Training, Algorithm Collection, etc), you should be able to stay comfortably above the "Recommended" power levels (while following the Recommended exploration stages) up until around Ch 3-12. Then it's time to start abusing friend/stranger support units to push the story, until you unlock the next upgrade tiers.

Speaking of friend supports, you can use them up to 5 times per day (and specific dolls only once) for story stages, but use them unlimitedly in farming stages (including "Endless" stages). Having your dolls used as supports gives Reputation Points which can be exchanged for free resources (e.g. Gacha rolls, EXP) per week.

About f2p: Quartz is the premium currency, only used for costumes and gacha (with a daily limit). Quartz Sand is like Gems, obtained through quests/story progression or paid monthly packs, but should be used somewhat proactively on things like as furniture tickets, Factory energy, or Keys (stamina).
